item.title: Shift of nanodroplet and nanocluster size distributions induced by dopant pick-up statistics
item.description: arXiv:2505.10516v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In pick-up experiments using nanodroplet and nanocluster beams, the size distribution of hosts carrying a specified number of dopants changes when the vapor density in the pick-up region is altered. This change, analyzed here, has quantitative consequences for the interpretation of data that are sensitive to host size, such as mass spectrometric, spectroscopic, and deflection measurements.
item.dc:creator: Marie Riddle, Angel I. Pena Dominguez, Benjamin S. Kamerin, Vitaly V. Kresin

item.title: Magnetic deflection of high-spin sodium dimers formed on helium nanodroplets
item.description: arXiv:2505.10523v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Spectroscopic data on alkali-atom dimers residing on the surface of liquid helium nanodroplets have revealed that they are detected primarily in the weakly bound, metastable, spin-triplet state. Here, by measuring the magnetic Stern-Gerlach deflection of a sodium-doped nanodroplet beam, we transparently demonstrate the abundance of high-magnetic-moment dimers. Their electron spins thermalize with the cryogenic superfluid droplets and become fully oriented by the external magnetic field.
item.dc:creator: Thomas H. Villers, Benjamin S. Kamerin, Vitaly V. Kresin
